about.about: Triton is the largest natural satellite of the planet Neptune, and the first Neptunian moon to be discovered. Triton has a surface of mostly frozen nitrogen, a mostly water-ice crust, an icy mantle and a substantial core of rock and metal. The core makes up two-thirds of its total mass.
about.discovery: Triton was discovered by British astronomer William Lassell on October 10, 1846, just 17 days after the discovery of Neptune.
about.name: Triton is named after the Greek sea god Triton, the son of Poseidon (the Greek god corresponding to the Roman Neptune).
